alert.note: Alert for Braxton; Cabell; Calhoun; Clay; Gilmer; Jackson; Kanawha; Lewis; Lincoln; Mason; Putnam; Roane; Wayne (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 24 at 5:11AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Calhoun, Kanawha, Putnam, northern Lincoln, Roane, southeastern Jackson, northeastern Wayne, southeastern Mason, southeastern Cabell, southern Gilmer, central Lewis, central Braxton and northern Clay Counties through 545 AM EDT... At 509 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Sandyville to near Barboursville. Movement was east at 60 mph. Winds at the Huntington airport gusted to 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds of 35 to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Charleston, Nitro, Ripley, Spencer, Winfield, Hamlin, Clay, Jefferson, South Charleston, St. Albans, Dunbar, Hurricane, Sissonville, Milton, Chesapeake, Eleanor, Marmet, Belle, Buffalo and Clendenin. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 1 and 52, and between mile markers 71 and 86. Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 96 and 138. Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 22 and 57. West Virginia Turnpike between mile markers 89 and 95. Route 119 between mile markers 66 and 80. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Braxton; Cabell; Calhoun; Clay; Gilmer; Jackson; Kanawha; Lewis; Lincoln; Mason; Putnam; Roane; Wayne
